prompt: Lonely, dim passenger train corridor between swaying burgundy cars, cracked phone screen glowing with ghosted texts, rain-streaked window framing a blurred figure ahead, cinematic melancholy, soft overhead fluorescents, shallow depth-of-field, 35 mm film look

Pan from their shared embrace to the window: the platform is sliding in; Harry phases transparent while your reflection keeps holding him. Let camera drift downward so the goodbye happens in glass, not flesh.

Camera lingers on the empty seat opposite: indent still warm, ticket inspector’s cap resting there with a folded note. Slowly dolly closer until the cap fills frame, paper edge fluttering like a last breath.

Pan the camera 30° right: tween-Harry materializes, hood-up, in the rearmost burgundy seat; child-Harry stays mid-frame offering the DS while adult-Harry’s parallel train window presses ghost-tight to yours.
